name: J-League Soccer V-Shoot
overview: J-League Soccer V-Shoot, commonly referred to as just V-Shoot, is a soccer arcade game that was released by Namco in 1994 only in Japan; it runs on their NB-1 hardware, and features the twelve (then-current) teams from the J-League (the Kashima Antlers, JEF United, the Urawa Red Diamonds, Tokyo Verdy, the Yokohama Marinos and Yokohama Flügels, Shonan Bellmare, Shimizu S-Pulse, Júbilo Iwata, Nagoya Grampus Eight, Gamba Osaka and Sanfrecce Hiroshima). All the players' names also reflect the teams' 1993 lineups - and a sequel, J-League Soccer Prime Goal EX, was released in 1996. Sega also released a J-League videogame of their own, The J-League '94 (which was later renamed to Super Visual Soccer).
